name: Spring Break From School
description:
This is a game that I created for IMS 445 at Miami University. It uses the Bitsy engine. The game is about my spring break trip to Florida my junior year of college. The game is an interactive story.

For those of you who live under a rock, spring break is defined as, “a week’s vacation for students in the spring, typically at Easter.” Spring break is a time where students can get away from their school-work and responsibilities before the end of the year. For most students, it’s a time to relax on the Florida beaches or ski in the Colorado mountains. Some students get a little wilder and head down to Mexico for some fun in the sun. This story takes you to the sunny shores of Panama City Beach, Florida. We spent 6 days on the beach; smoking cigars, drinking cheap beer, and having a good time.

Spring Break is more than just an escape from adulthood. It’s a time where close friends become even closer. After spending 12 hours driving down, 144 hours within twenty feet of one-another, and then another 12 hours driving home; you learn a lot about each other. For better or worse, it’s an experience that almost every college student will experience at least once in their life. This is my story.
